This comes from the file `dataset/CA_census_tract_dataclean.Rmd`.

```{r setup}
library(tidyverse)
```

##Data tidying:

```{r data tidy}
CAcountytract <- read_csv("CA_countytract.csv") %>% 
  rename("remaining" = "TYPE; FULLCODE; STATE; COUNTY; TRACT; SHEETS") %>% #creating easier to use name
  separate(col="remaining", into = c("TYPE", "remains1"), (5)) %>% #creating TYPE column
  separate(col="remains1", into = c("semi1", "remains11"), sep=(1)) %>% #separating semicolon
  separate(col="remains11", into = c("FULLCODE", "remains2"), sep = (11)) %>% #creating FULLCODE column
  separate(col="remains2", into = c("semi2", "remains22"), sep=(1)) %>% #separating semicolon
  separate(col="remains22", into = c("STATE", "remains3"), sep = (2)) %>% #creating STATE column
  separate(col="remains3", into = c("semi3", "remains33"), sep=(1)) %>% #separating semicolon
  separate(col="remains33", into = c("COUNTY", "remains4"), sep = (3)) %>% #creating COUNTY column
  separate(col="remains4", into = c("semi4", "remains44"), sep=(1)) %>% #separating semicolon
  separate(col="remains44", into = c("TRACT", "SHEETS"), sep = ";") %>% #creating TRACT and SHEETS columns
  unite(col = "COUNTY_CODE", c("STATE", "COUNTY"), sep="", remove = FALSE) %>% #uniting columns to make COUNTY_CODE
  select(-semi1, -semi2, -semi3, -semi4, -"...3", -"...4", -"...5", -"...6")
#head(CAcountytract)
```
